intro: Calospermum parvum, commonly known as the small-flowered calospermum, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to the eastern United States. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calospermum parvum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
